docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Welcome to the official documentation hub for MDMY Group. This site contains comprehensive guides, references, and resources to help you get the most out of our products and services.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Easy Navigation: Browse through our documentation using the navigation menu on the left.
  • Search: Find specific information using the search function at the top.
  • Mobile Friendly: Access documentation on the go from your mobile device.
  • Printable: Print any page or section for offline reference.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: To begin, check out our Getting Started Guide which provides an introduction to our products and services.

docs.title: Documentation Sections
docs.text: Section Description Guides Step-by-step instructions and tutorials Reference Technical references and API documentation

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If you need assistance beyond what's covered in our documentation:

  • Contact support at support@example.com
  • Visit our community forums at forums.example.com
  • Submit feature requests or bug reports through our issue tracker

Last updated: April 2025

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with MDMY products and services quickly and efficiently.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • An account with MDMY Group
  • Basic understanding of [relevant technology/domain]
  • [Any other prerequisites]

docs.title: Step 1: Download the Software
docs.text:
# Example command to download or install
curl -O https://example.com/download/mdmy-tool

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Your Environment
docs.text:
Create a configuration file in your project directory:

# Example configuration
api_key: YOUR_API_KEY
environment: production
debug: false

docs.title: Step 3: Run Initial Setup
docs.text:
# Example setup command
mdmy-tool setup --init

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
Here's a simple example of how to use our main product:

# Python example code
from mdmy import Client

# Initialize the client
client = Client(api_key="your_api_key")

# Perform an action
result = client.perform_action(parameter="value")
print(result)

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you've set up the basics, you might want to explore:

  • Guide 1: Learn about feature X
  • Guide 2: Advanced configurations
  • API Reference: Full API documentation

docs.title: Problem: Connection Errors
docs.text:
If you experience connection errors, check:

  1. Your network connection
  2. API key validity
  3. Server status at status.example.com

docs.title: Problem: Performance Issues
docs.text:
For optimal performance:

  • Use connection pooling
  • Implement caching strategies
  • Follow our performance optimization guide

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If you need additional help, see our support options on the homepage.

Last updated: April 2025

docs.title: Guides & Tutorials
docs.text: This section contains detailed guides and tutorials to help you master various aspects of MDMY products and services.

docs.title: Beginner Guides
docs.text:
These guides are perfect for users who are just getting started:

  • Guide 1: Getting Started with Feature X - A beginner's introduction to Feature X
  • Guide 2: Advanced Configuration - Learn how to configure the system for optimal performance

docs.title: Advanced Topics
docs.text:
Once you're comfortable with the basics, explore these advanced guides:

  • Advanced Topic 1 - Coming Soon
  • Advanced Topic 2 - Coming Soon

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
For optimal results with MDMY products, consider these best practices:

  1. Regular Updates: Keep your installation updated to the latest version
  2. Data Backups: Implement regular data backup procedures
  3. Monitoring: Set up system monitoring to catch issues early
  4. Security: Follow our security recommendations

docs.title: Request a Guide
docs.text:
Don't see the guide you need? Contact us at documentation@example.com to request a specific guide or tutorial.

Last updated: April 2025

docs.title: Guide 1: Getting Started with Feature X
Introduction
docs.text: Feature X is a powerful component of our platform that allows you to [brief explanation of what Feature X does]. This guide will walk you through setting up and using Feature X to accomplish common tasks.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before using Feature X, ensure you have:

  • Completed the general setup
  • [Any specific prerequisites for Feature X]
  • [Permission level/access requirements if applicable]

docs.title: Step 1: Enable Feature X
docs.text: In your account settings, navigate to Features > Feature Management and toggle on Feature X:

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Initial Settings
docs.text:
Navigate to the Feature X dashboard and configure these essential settings:

  1. API Access: Generate an API key for Feature X
  2. Storage: Configure your storage preferences
  3. Notifications: Set up alert preferences

docs.title: Creating Your First Project
docs.text:
1. From the Feature X dashboard, click New Project
  2. Enter a project name and description
  3. Select a project template
  4. Click Create
{
  "project": {
    "name": "My First Project",
    "description": "A demonstration project",
    "template": "standard",
    "createdBy": "user@example.com"
  }
}

docs.title: Importing Existing Data
docs.text:
To import existing data into Feature X:

  1. Prepare your data in one of the supported formats (.csv, .json, .xml)
  2. From the Feature X dashboard, select Import Data
  3. Follow the import wizard to map your data fields
  4. Click Complete Import

docs.title: Advanced Configuration
docs.text:
Pro Tip

You can automate Feature X operations using our REST API or command-line tools. See the API Reference for details.

docs.title: Custom Templates
docs.text:
Create custom templates for frequently used project types:

  1. Navigate to Templates > Create New
  2. Design your template using the visual editor
  3. Save and publish your template

docs.title: Integration with Other Services
docs.text:
Feature X integrates seamlessly with:

  • Service A: For enhanced reporting
  • Service B: For automated workflows
  • Service C: For data synchronization

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text: Issue Possible Cause Solution Connection errors Network firewall Whitelist our IP ranges Slow performance Large datasets Enable data chunking Import failures Incorrect format Verify data structure

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you encounter issues not covered here:

  1. Check our knowledge base
  2. Contact support via the in-app chat
  3. Email support@example.com

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you're familiar with Feature X basics, explore these advanced topics:

  • Guide 2: Advanced Configuration
  • API automation strategies Coming Soon
  • Data migration patterns Coming Soon

Last updated: April 2025

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This guide covers advanced configuration options for optimizing your MDMY implementation. These settings allow you to fine-tune performance, enhance security, and customize behaviors to suit your specific requirements.

docs.title: Caching Strategies
docs.text:
Implementing proper caching can significantly improve response times:

cache:
  enabled: true
  type: "redis"  # Options: memory, redis, memcached
  ttl: 3600      # Time-to-live in seconds
  max_size: "2g" # Maximum cache size
  invalidation:
    - "api_update"
    - "admin_change"

docs.title: Connection Pooling
docs.text:
Configure connection pooling to handle high loads efficiently:

connections:
  pool_size: 25          # Maximum number of connections
  idle_timeout: 300      # Seconds before closing idle connections
  connection_timeout: 30 # Seconds to wait before connection timeout
  retry:
    attempts: 3
    backoff: "exponential"

docs.title: Memory Management
docs.text:
Adjust memory allocation based on your server resources:

memory:
  heap_size: "4g"
  garbage_collection: "adaptive"
  low_memory_threshold: "15%"

docs.title: Security Hardening
docs.text:
Security Notice

These settings significantly affect system security. Test thoroughly before applying to production environments.

docs.title: API Rate Limiting
docs.text:
Implement rate limiting to protect against abuse:

rate_limit:
  enabled: true
  requests_per_minute: 120
  burst_allowance: 20
  by_ip: true
  by_user: true
  response:
    status_code: 429
    message: "Rate limit exceeded. Try again in {retry_after} seconds."

docs.title: Authentication Enhancements
docs.text:
Strengthen authentication security:

  1. Multi-factor Authentication: Enable and configure MFA requirements
  2. Session Management: Adjust session timeout and refresh policies
  3. JWT Configuration: Configure token lifetime and signing algorithms

docs.title: IP Allow-listing
docs.text:
Restrict access to trusted networks:

ip_security:
  enforce: true
  allowed_ranges:
    - "10.0.0.0/8"     # Internal network
    - "192.168.1.0/24" # Office network
    - "203.0.113.0/24" # Remote office
  blocked_ranges:
    - "198.51.100.0/24"

docs.title: Custom Plugins
docs.text:
Register and configure custom plugins:

plugins:
  - name: "custom-reporter"
    enabled: true
    config_path: "/path/to/plugin/config.json"
    priority: 50

  - name: "data-transformer"
    enabled: true
    mappings:
      - source: "legacy_field"
        target: "new_field"
        transform: "uppercase"

docs.title: Event Hooks
docs.text:
Configure event hooks for custom logic:

hooks:
  pre_processing:
    - script: "/scripts/validate_input.py"
      timeout: 5

  post_processing:
    - script: "/scripts/notify_completion.py"
      timeout: 10

  on_error:
    - script: "/scripts/handle_error.py"
      timeout: 15

docs.title: Production Environment
docs.text:
Recommended settings for production:

environment: "production"
debug: false
logging:
  level: "warn"
  format: "json"
  outputs:
    - type: "file"
      path: "/var/log/mdmy/app.log"
    - type: "syslog"
performance:
  optimization: "throughput"

docs.title: Development Environment
docs.text:
Recommended settings for development:

environment: "development"
debug: true
logging:
  level: "debug"
  format: "pretty"
  outputs:
    - type: "console"
hot_reload: true
performance:
  optimization: "debug"

docs.title: Configuration Validation
docs.text:
Before applying your configuration, validate it using our configuration testing tool:

mdmy-tool validate-config --config=/path/to/config.yaml

Look for warning or error messages and address them before deploying.

docs.title: High-Performance Web Service
docs.text:
# Example high-performance configuration
cache:
  enabled: true
  type: "redis_cluster"
connections:
  pool_size: 100
memory:
  heap_size: "16g"
performance:
  thread_count: "auto"
  io_mode: "async"
  prefetch: true

docs.title: Secure Internal Service
docs.text:
# Example security-focused configuration
authentication:
  provider: "oauth2"
  jwt_lifetime: 900
  refresh_tokens: false
ip_security:
  enforce: true
  allowed_ranges:
    - "10.0.0.0/8"
encryption:
  transport: "tls1.3"
  data_at_rest: true
  key_rotation: 30

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After configuring these advanced settings:

  • Run thorough performance tests
  • Set up monitoring and alerts
  • Review the security checklist

Last updated: April 2025

docs.title: Reference Documentation
docs.text: This section contains technical reference documentation for MDMY products, including API references, configuration options, and data formats.

docs.title: Available References
docs.text:
• API Reference - Complete documentation of our public APIs
  • Configuration Reference - Coming Soon
  • Data Models Reference - Coming Soon

docs.title: Using the Reference Documentation
docs.text:
Our reference documentation is designed to be:

  • Comprehensive: Covering all public interfaces and options
  • Accurate: Reflecting the current release version
  • Searchable: Easy to find specific information
  • Example-Rich: Including practical usage examples

docs.title: API Status
docs.text: API Version Status Sunset Date Core API 2.1 Stable N/A Legacy API 1.8 Deprecated Dec 2025 New Features API 3.0-beta Beta N/A

docs.title: Versioning & Deprecation
docs.text:
We follow semantic versioning (SemVer) for our APIs:

  • MAJOR version changes indicate incompatible API changes
  • MINOR version changes add functionality in a backwards-compatible manner
  • PATCH version changes include backwards-compatible bug fixes

Features marked as deprecated will be supported for at least 12 months before removal.

docs.title: Suggest Improvements
docs.text:
Our reference documentation is continuously updated. If you find any errors or omissions, please:

  • Submit an issue on our GitHub repository
  • Email us at documentation@example.com

Last updated: April 2025

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The MDMY API allows you to programmatically access and control MDMY services. This reference documents all endpoints, parameters, and responses.

Base URL for all API calls: 

https://api.example.com/v2

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All API requests require authentication using an API key. You can obtain an API key from your MDMY dashboard.

Include your API key in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text:
All responses are returned in JSON format and include a standard structure:

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    // Response data here
  },
  "meta": {
    "totalPages": 3,
    "currentPage": 1,
    "perPage": 10,
    "totalCount": 27
  }
}

Error responses follow this structure:

{
  "success": false,
  "error": {
    "code": "invalid_request",
    "message": "Description of the error",
    "details": {
      // Additional error information if available
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Rate Limiting
docs.text:
API requests are subject to rate limiting to ensure fair usage and system stability. Current limits:

  • 100 requests per minute for standard accounts
  • 1000 requests per minute for enterprise accounts

Rate limit information is included in response headers:

  • X-RateLimit-Limit: Total requests allowed per minute
  • X-RateLimit-Remaining: Requests remaining in current window
  • X-RateLimit-Reset: Unix timestamp when the rate limit resets

docs.title: Common Parameters
docs.text:
Many endpoints support these common query parameters:

Parameter Type Description page integer Page number for paginated results (default: 1) perPage integer Number of results per page (default: 10, max: 100) sort string Field to sort by (e.g., name, createdAt) order string Sort order (asc or desc, default: asc) fields string Comma-separated list of fields to include

docs.title: List Projects
docs.text:
GET /projects

Query Parameters:

Parameter Type Description status string Filter by project status (active, archived, draft) createdAfter ISO date Filter by creation date after specified date category string Filter by project category

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "proj_123abc",
      "name": "Sample Project",
      "description": "A sample project",
      "status": "active",
      "createdAt": "2025-03-15T14:30:00Z",
      "updatedAt": "2025-04-01T09:15:22Z"
    },
    // Additional projects...
  ],
  "meta": {
    "totalPages": 3,
    "currentPage": 1,
    "perPage": 10,
    "totalCount": 27
  }
}

docs.title: Get a Project
docs.text:
GET /projects/{projectId}

Path Parameters:

Parameter Description projectId The unique identifier of the project

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": "proj_123abc",
    "name": "Sample Project",
    "description": "A sample project",
    "status": "active",
    "settings": {
      "visibility": "private",
      "notifications": true
    },
    "createdBy": "user_456def",
    "createdAt": "2025-03-15T14:30:00Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-04-01T09:15:22Z"
  }
}

docs.title: Create a Project
docs.text:
POST /projects

Request Body:

{
  "name": "New Project",
  "description": "Description of the new project",
  "status": "draft",
  "settings": {
    "visibility": "private",
    "notifications": true
  }
}

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": "proj_789ghi",
    "name": "New Project",
    "description": "Description of the new project",
    "status": "draft",
    "settings": {
      "visibility": "private",
      "notifications": true
    },
    "createdBy": "user_456def",
    "createdAt": "2025-04-28T10:00:00Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-04-28T10:00:00Z"
  }
}

docs.title: Update a Project
docs.text:
PATCH /projects/{projectId}

Path Parameters:

Parameter Description projectId The unique identifier of the project

Request Body: 

{
  "name": "Updated Project Name",
  "description": "Updated project description",
  "status": "active"
}

Response: 

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": "proj_123abc",
    "name": "Updated Project Name",
    "description": "Updated project description",
    "status": "active",
    "settings": {
      "visibility": "private",
      "notifications": true
    },
    "createdBy": "user_456def",
    "createdAt": "2025-03-15T14:30:00Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-04-28T11:15:00Z"
  }
}

docs.title: Delete a Project
docs.text:
DELETE /projects/{projectId}

Path Parameters:

Parameter Description projectId The unique identifier of the project

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "message": "Project successfully deleted"
  }
}

docs.title: Get Current User
docs.text:
GET /users/me

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": "user_456def",
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "role": "admin",
    "createdAt": "2024-10-12T08:30:00Z",
    "lastLoginAt": "2025-04-25T15:42:10Z"
  }
}

docs.title: Webhooks
docs.text: You can configure webhooks to receive real-time notifications when events occur in your MDMY account.

docs.title: Webhook Event Types
docs.text: Event Type Description project.created Triggered when a new project is created project.updated Triggered when a project is updated project.deleted Triggered when a project is deleted user.login Triggered when a user logs in data.import.completed Triggered when a data import completes

docs.title: Webhook Payload Example
docs.text:
{
  "event": "project.created",
  "timestamp": "2025-04-28T10:00:00Z",
  "data": {
    "id": "proj_789ghi",
    "name": "New Project",
    "createdBy": "user_456def"
  }
}

docs.title: Error Codes
docs.text: Code Description HTTP Status authentication_required No API key provided 401 invalid_api_key API key is invalid or expired 401 permission_denied Insufficient permissions 403 resource_not_found Requested resource not found 404 validation_error Invalid request parameters 400 rate_limit_exceeded Too many requests 429 internal_error Internal server error 500

docs.title: SDKs and Libraries
docs.text:
We provide official client libraries for several programming languages:

  • JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Python
  • PHP
  • Ruby
  • Java

docs.title: API Versioning
docs.text:
The API version is included in the base URL. When we release a new incompatible API version, we will increment the version number (e.g., from /v2 to /v3).

Previous versions remain available for at least 12 months after a new version is released.

docs.title: Security and Compliance
docs.text:
Our API adheres to industry security standards including:

  • TLS 1.2+ encryption for all communications
  • OAuth 2.0 for authorization
  • GDPR-compliant data handling
  • Regular security audits and penetration testing

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If you encounter any issues or have questions about our API:

  • Check our API documentation
  • Contact us at api-support@example.com
  • Submit issues via our GitHub repository

Last updated: April 2025
